alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Lee and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Louisa, Henderson, Mercer and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Louisa, Mercer and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Clinton and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess, Carroll and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Clinton, Whiteside and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Henderson, Lee and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lock and Dam 18 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.4 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.
